recipe_name: Pears poached in red wine and rosemary with Northumberland cheese
author: Lesley Waters
method: Heat the wine and sugar in a pan until the sugar dissolves. Add the pear pieces and the rosemary and simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until the pears are soft and the sauce has thickened. To serve, place a spoonful of the sauce onto a serving plate and top with the pears and the cheese.
ingredients: 150ml/Â¼ pint red wine,  85g/3oz caster sugar,  1 pear, peeled, cored and quartered,  sprig fresh rosemary ,  55g/2oz Northumberland cheese, crumbled, to serve
